title: Automatically open downloaded csv files with Excel
content:
I have for many years tried to have excel automatically open downloaded .csv files as I do this every day many times. Until today I have not been able to understand why, despite having asked for Firefox to automatically open .csv files with Excel, and therefore finding "Microsoft Excel Comma Separated Values File" associated to "Use Excel (Default)" in the application association list in the General settings, Firefox continues to ask what to do with the .csv file type when downloading.

What I have discovered is that when using a search for associations in the General tab, csv gives no results! However searching for cel does for some reason list the "Microsoft Excel Comma Separated Values File".

It seems to me that the file type three letter code for the Microsoft excel csv file is wrongly stated in the association list. Is my assumption right? If so how can I correct this please?

For information I have had this problem on more than one computer! I have just set this up on a brand new laptop when discovering this.

Images attached... Thank you.

title: Firefox Destroyed Session Restore
content:
Firefox (97.0 64 bit, windows 10) destroyed all my previous tabs (4 windows lots of tabs) when I opened it despite always having "Firefox will" set to "Remember History". It just opened one window with the Home page.

Trying to sort it out using restore all tabs and then all windows, it just made the problem worse and the restored tabs eventually stopped restoring so now I have useless json files.

The files I have in my profile are:

previous.jsonlz4 15/2/2022 18:46 recovery.baklz4 15/2/2022 19:10 recovery.jsonlz4 15/2/2022 19:10 (this file changes its name from bak to json and back to bak again, very odd) upgrade.jsonlz4-20220119190439 26/1/2022 00:23 upgrade.jsonlz4-20220126154723 29/1/2022 04:31 upgrade.jsonlz4-20220202182137 12/2/2022 17:40

Is it possible "previous.jsonlz4" may have all the windows and tabs that I lost?

If so, how could I get Firefox to use it when I next open it? (assuming if I close this browser it won't overwrite the "previous.jsonlz4" file??).

Also could I use the upgrade.jsonlz4 file to try to restore all the windows and tabs that I lost? The windows would have been much the same on 12 Feb as they were today before the destruction.

title: Blue windows loading circle only in Firefox when hovering over URLs or in the address bar
content:
Hello!

After updating my Nvidia Geforce Experience drivers I'm now encountering a weird mouse cursor error in Firefox only.

When I hover over an URL or go into the address bar my cursor changes to the windows loading/activity blue circle https://i.imgur.com/mnyy74m.png

In Chrome or any other browser I don't have that problem and links are the normal finger/hand cursor.

Also when trying to copy the text of an URL the cursor also keeps staying that blue circle.

I've tried to repair Firefox and uninstalled Firefox and installed it with a new setup. Also restarted my computer.

When I go into the Windows mouse settings and change the blue circle icon into another icon I can see that the change works. So Firefox somehow believes that Windows is working/loading something whenever I hover over an URL / go into the address bar.

Does someone have another tip? Is there a tool to delete all Firefox related files (maybe something is cached or a registry is corrupt?).

Thanks in advance.

I use the newest Windows 10 update and newest Nvidia 3060ti drivers from today.

Edit: the Firefox safe mode also shows the same errors, so any addon isn't the problem.

Edit2: The loading circle seems to appears on literally everyhing that is interactable (for example just normal text, text boxes, links, images etc.) Interestingly enough the bookmarks work normally and I get the normal cursor when hovering over it.

title: Firefox will not display my index.html if I type 'www.mysite.com/index.html'
content:
I'm developing my company's website, located at www.deccopainting.com - which displays the home page fine, but when I link back from other pages using "index.html" - firefox displays a message from my host provider suggesting that index.html is not there.

index.html is in fact there, obviously, and the link to index.html displays in Chrome, Edge, and every single other browser I've tested it on, it's only Firefox that does not display index.html if it's actually typed in the URL bar or linked from another page.

You can test this by first going to www.deccopainting.com (site is not complete) and then going to www.deccopainting.com/index.html.

I am aware I can use <a href="www.deccopainting.com"> instead, but why should I have to do this, when every other browser on the market works as it should??

title: Button doesn't work in firefox extensions?
content:
Hi everyone, I have created an extension that can be used from the usual position at the top right through which you can do some things, including open a website locally. To be clearer ...

Extension Folder: - extension.js - manifest.json - LocalWebSite (folder)

Inside the LocalWebSite folder: - index.html

Then clicking the button via the extension will load the local website. At this point, when the local website is opened it becomes impossible to trigger any button, modal, or whatever, it's a totally static page.

One important thing is that I don't want to replace the popup with the static page, I wish I could have both.

Extension Code: // SiteWebLocale function openWebSite () { 

   browser.tabs.create ({        "url": "./LocalWebSite/index.html"    });

} document.getElementById ("openWebSite"). addEventListener ("click", openWebSite);

Local Website Button Code (It doesn't work): <button type = "button" class = "btn btn-danger" onclick = "alert ('ok')"> Action </button>

title: Slack notifications with multiple tabs open in random tab
content:
At my software development job, we use Slack. This means two things: (1) I have at least one Slack tab open at all times; and (2) there are links to Slack threads in our JIRA issues.

Suppose I start working on an issue. I click on a Slack link from that issue, to get the necessary context. Now I have two Slack tabs open.

Next, someone posts to a channel I’m subscribed to. A desktop notification pops up.

When I click the Activate button in the notification, it activates one of the Slack tabs I have, and opens the newly posted message in this tab. It seems to choose to activate the most recently active Slack tab. Depending on what I was doing, that may be the tab I opened for reference. This may then switch me away from the reference thread, destroying my context. I then have to click “Back” one or more times in order to get the context back.

Is it possible to control which tabs notifications activate? All else being equal, I would like Slack notifications select the tab that is pinned, or the one opened least recently, or the one that was was NOT opened by following a link from another site.

Slack support says they don’t control which tab gets activated. They suggest that I install and use the standalone Slack desktop application, but I do not want that because it does not afford me the same degree of customizability as Firefox does.
creator: yurivkhan

title: Print Preview is gone and changing print.tab_modal.enabled to false does not fix it
content:
As many people have said, replacing Print Preview with a "new print experience" creates a huge hardship for many users. Not only does it save paper, but the "Simplify" button allows the printing of pages that otherwise cannot be printed.

When the new print experience was first rolled out, I was able to revert back to Print Preview as described in the support forum here, and all was well for about three months.

Print Preview disappeared again last week, and changing print.tab_modal.enabled to false does NOT fix it this time. There is no corresponding app.normandy switch. This happened on two different computers whose browsers are not synced with each other.

Some advisers have said that clicking "use the system dialogue" gives access to Print Preview, but that is not the case on either of these computers.

Running Windows 10 Home and FireFox 97.0 (64 bit) on both machines.

Please help.

title: Visiting Any Webpage Appears Blank, then Firefox Crashes
content:
Hi,

After updating Firefox version 97, any webpage I visit doesn't load. For example, when I open Firefox and visit youtube.com, it gets stuck on a blank continuously loading white page. When I close and attempt to re-open Firefox, it doesn't open until I task kill firefox.exe. Interestingly, there are multiple instances of firefox.exe open when I task kill.

Here are all the basic fixes I tried but to no avail:

- Ensured all drivers and Windows Updates are up-to-date - Started Firefox in Safe Mode and disabled all add-ons - Uninstall Firefox then reinstall - Rename all the Mozilla folders in %appdata% to Mozilla.old - Delete the residual Mozilla folder in Program Files - Delete all Mozilla keys in the registry (HKLM\SOFTWARE\Mozilla, HKCU\SOFTWARE\Mozilla) - Ran sfc /scannow, dism /online /cleanup-image /restorehealth, chkdsk c: /f - Checked c:\windows\system32\drivers\etc\hosts file to ensure no odd entries - Checked network and DNS settings for anything out of the ordinary

Here is my system information:

Windows 10 Pro 10.0.19044 N/A Build 19044 Intel i7-4790 8 Gbs memory 512 SSD

This issue has left me stumped, and I think it may have something to do with v97 (even though it works fine on my other PC). Does anyone have any suggestions on fixing this issue (other than wiping the PC)? Please note that different browsers such as Edge and Chrome work perfectly fine. Let me know if you could use more information. Thanks in advance!

Regards, Adrian
creator: adrian.gaviola

title: Attn:  Jscher2000    Re Display All Bookmarks (not just folders) in New FF Window
content:
Hi again J 

   Older thread  https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1284813    now closed of course.        You suggested    "If you paste the following address to the address bar of a new window and press Enter to load it, you have largely the same functionality:"

chrome://browser/content/places/bookmarksSidebar.xhtml 

   Good idea.   Yes, "largely."   Then I bookmarked "that page"   And then pinned/locked that 'bookmark' as a tab in my Default Session.         Then ...

"You can hold the Shift key and left-click the bookmark to open the bookmark (link) in a new window. This should always work to open a link in a new window." Mozilla Support. Which it does. 

   Bingo.     Standard browser window.   Separate Window with All folders and All bookmarks in a ONE PANE in its own window, so any and all bookmarks are visible concurrently.    The Browser and Bookmarks show on Taskbar as two icons for toggling ("never combine")  and the critical functionality from ancient FF 3.26 (not the portable) and later via AiOS or "Good 'Ol Sidebar" is back in business.      Took me awhile for the opportunity to investigate this, but I appreciate your experience and patience.    Cheers!
creator: pietertvl1
